 SimilarityPair compareAnnotationsBySourcePair(java.lang.String aeid, java.lang.String src1, java.lang.String src2, LinkQueryTerm closureQueryTerm)
          Given an annotated entity (such as a human gene or genotype), and two annotation sources (eg fb and zfin), return a SimilarityPair object that summarises the total set of attributes of that AE as determined by the two sources; here the set of attributes is the classes used to annotate the AEs, plus their "parents" as determined by the closureQueryTerm This method is most useful when there are two or more agents annotating the same entity; for example, as in double-blind experiments or the NCBO IMIM 3x coverage annotation of OMIM genotypes.
protected  SimilarityPair compareAnnotationSetPair(java.util.Collection<LinkStatement> stmts1, java.util.Collection<LinkStatement> stmts2, LinkQueryTerm extQt)
          given two sets of annotations, return a SimilarityPair indicating target nodes in common if extQt is not null, then the annotations are extended using this query term For example, given a set of asserted/direct annotations, we may want to extend these to be implied annotations

getStatements

public java.util.Collection<Statement> getStatements(java.lang.String ns)
Description copied from interface: Shard
fetches all statements from a particular source. All statements, whether LinkStatements or LiteralStatements, should have some source. This may be identical to the source of the node, or it may be separate (for example, it is valid for a non_OMIM source to annotate an OMIM ID).

Caution: may return multiple results

Specified by:
getStatements in interface Shard
Parameters:
ns - a unique global identifier for the source. E.g. OMIM
Returns:
all statements that have this source

Description copied from interface: Shard
fetches all statements about an entity, identified by some node ID

Here "about" corresponds to "subject" in RDF terminology. Each Statement has a subject -- what the statement is about.

getAnnotationGraphAroundNode

public Graph getAnnotationGraphAroundNode(java.lang.String id,
                                          Shard.EntailmentUse entailment,
                                          Shard.GraphExpansionAlgorithm gea)
for a COI, this builds the following graph: R(A,X) where R'(E,AC),R''(AC,COI) union R(A,COI) this is typically large: for all annotated entities in the graph, we fetch all the surrounding relations, not just those in the path to COI

Specified by:
getAnnotationGraphAroundNode in interface Shard
Parameters:
id - For example: an ontology class unique ID
Returns:
given a node (eg a class in an ontology), return a graph centered around this node, including annotation to nodes subsumed by this node

getSimilarNodes

public java.util.List<ScoredNode> getSimilarNodes(java.lang.String nodeId)
Description copied from interface: Shard
given an annotated entity node (e.g. a PMID or a genotype ID) this will return all similar nodes attached to a score for that node. The similarity is determined by finding other annotated entities with similar annotation profiles. The score is an uncorrected p-value (low values close to zero indicate high degree of similarity).

Specified by:
getSimilarNodes in interface Shard
Returns:
all comparable nodes with similarity p-value

getClosureMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getClosureMap(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> ids,
                                                                                     java.lang.String relId)

getClosureMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getClosureMap(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> ids,
                                                                                     QueryTerm extQt)

getClosureMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getClosureMap(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> ids,
                                                                                     QueryTerm extQt,
                                                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> map)
This extends the existing closureMap. If ids contains s1,s2,...,sn and the shard has s1->s1a,s1b,... etc these will be added to the map passing in an existing closureMap will both extend that map, and also use the map to efficiently query the shard. This means the extQt must be invariant over multiple calls. It is up to the caller to be safe here

Parameters:
ids -
extQt -
map - - new keys and values will be added
Returns:

getAnnotatedEntityCountBySubset

public java.util.Map<Node,java.lang.Integer> getAnnotatedEntityCountBySubset(AnnotationLinkQueryTerm qt,
                                                                             java.lang.String subsetId)
                                                                      throws ShardExecutionException
Description copied from interface: Shard
Given a set of annotations and a subset/view over an ontology(s), map all annotations to the subset and then count the number of DISTINCT annotated entities related to the mapped class. The deductive closure is used here.

Formally: count(n) = |e| where e R n Here, e R n denotes that there is some relation R between e and n that can be deduced from some annotation, plus the axioms in the ontology. The value of R is by default left unbound; it can be set by passing in the appropriate annotation query object For example, if the annotations contained: genotype1 size of Eyeball genotype2 thickness of Wall of eyeball genotype2 color of Iris Then the count for "Eyeball" would be 2, because both genotypes are related to "Eyeball" via some chain of relations (specific relations can be selected using methods on the annotation query. In the example above, part_of is included) Note that if the subset contains the class "Organ", then these annotated entities would also count for this class

Specified by:
getAnnotatedEntityCountBySubset in interface Shard
Parameters:
qt - query for fetching annotations. If null will select all
subsetId - identifier for the subset/view to map to
Returns:
counts broken down by class node used to annotate
Throws:
ShardExecutionException

compareAnnotationsBySourcePair

                                                     java.lang.String src2)
Description copied from interface: Shard

Specified by:
compareAnnotationsBySourcePair in interface Shard
Returns:

compareAnnotationsBySourcePair

public SimilarityPair compareAnnotationsBySourcePair(java.lang.String aeid,
                                                     java.lang.String src1,
                                                     java.lang.String src2,
                                                     LinkQueryTerm closureQueryTerm)
Description copied from interface: Shard
Given an annotated entity (such as a human gene or genotype), and two annotation sources (eg fb and zfin), return a SimilarityPair object that summarises the total set of attributes of that AE as determined by the two sources; here the set of attributes is the classes used to annotate the AEs, plus their "parents" as determined by the closureQueryTerm This method is most useful when there are two or more agents annotating the same entity; for example, as in double-blind experiments or the NCBO IMIM 3x coverage annotation of OMIM genotypes. Ideally different curators will annotate the same genotype in different ways (the similiarity score in the SimilarityPair object will be high), but in practice this will not be the case.

Specified by:
compareAnnotationsBySourcePair in interface Shard
Parameters:
aeid - - e.g. OMIM:601653
src1 - - e.g. omim_phenotype_zfin
Returns:
